intro: Bucida correlliana, commonly known as the coral tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub, typically reaching heights of up to 10 meters. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often arranged in a feather-like pattern, and its showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. Bucida correlliana thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a popular ornamental plant.
